com.tokelon.toktales.core.game.state

Interface IGameStateInputHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IInputCallback
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IAndroidGameStateInputHandler, IDesktopGameStateInputHandler, IEngineGamestateInputHandler, ILocalMapInputHandler
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AndroidConsoleInputHandler, AndroidConsoleIntegrationInputHandler, AndroidInitialGamestateInputHandler, AndroidLocalMapInputHandler, AndroidPassthroughGamestateInputHandler, DesktopConsoleInputHandler, DesktopConsoleIntegrationInputHandler, DesktopEngineGamestateInputHandler, DesktopLocalMapInputHandler, DesktopPassthroughGamestateInputHandler, DesktopUserGamestateInputHandler, IGameStateInputHandler.EmptyGameStateInputHandler

    public interface IGameStateInputHandler
extends IInputCallback
    Receives input and processes so it gets used by a gamestate.

    Normally uses IControlScheme and IControlHandler of the gamestate.

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean register(IGameStateInput stateInput)
      Registers this input handler to the given state input.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.tokelon.toktales.core.engine.input.IInputCallback

        handle

    • Method Detail

      • register

        default boolean register(IGameStateInput stateInput)
        Registers this input handler to the given state input.

        The default implementation for this simply calls IInputRegistration.registerInputCallback(IInputCallback), and returns the result.

        Parameters:
        stateInput -
        Returns:
        True if registration was successful, false if not.
